div.p: Greetings. It has been a long time since I received any letters from you.

What has been done here regarding the controversy between Savoy and Bern, you will understand better from the arbitrator than I can explain in writing; in short, everything has been postponed to another time, like the matter of the council. The king was crowned on the 15th of this month and is now at Villecscelerem, a day's journey from Paris. I am sending you a true likeness of the king.

Many have high hopes for him; may the Lord bless him. If I did not think you had seen the response of the Strasbourg republic to the papal legate's demands, I would have sent it to you. Please convey my greetings to the esteemed council and all friends.
Basel, the last day of May.
To Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, preacher of the city of Zurich.
